question:
The President has the power of Suspensive Veto in case of:
  1. Money bill
  2. Ordinary bill
  3. Constitutional Amendment bill
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: The President exercises Suspensive Veto when he returns a bill for reconsideration of the Parliament. The President has no Suspensive veto in case of Money bill. Similarly, President cannot send a Constitutional Amendment bill for reconsideration of the Parliament. Thus, Suspensive Veto is exercised by the President only in case of Ordinary bills passed by the Parliament.
